abstract.text: A request to search for notes, tasks, and reminders.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object when the user asks to search for existing notes, tasks, and reminders. The intent object contains search parameters such as the type of items to return, strings to match against the title or content, the completion status of tasks, or the trigger conditions used to generate reminders.
To handle this intent, the handler object in your Intents extension must adopt the
protocol. Your handler should confirm the request and create an
The following table lists additional attributes of this intent object:

Users can ask Siri to search for notebook items in a variety of ways. The table below provides a few sample phrases in different languages. You can use these phrases during testing to trigger your intents. This list isn’t exhaustive and Siri may recognize many other phrases.
Show me all my notes on
Show me what I created last week on
显示我上个星期所有新建立的(在 appName> 上)
顯示我所有的備忘錄(在
اعرض ما تم إنشاؤه الأسبوع الماضي على
vis mig alle mine noter i
vis mig hvad blev oprettet i
Zeige mir alle meine Notizen auf
Zeig mir die Notizen die ich letzte Woche in
Montre-moi ce que j’ai créé la semaine dernière sur
תראי לי את כל הפתקים ב
תראי מה יצרתי שבוע שעבר ב
Mostrami tutte le mie note su
Mostrami cosa ho creato la scorsa settimana su
で先週作ったメモを全部見せて
에서 지난 주에 만든 것 보여줘
Tunjukkan item yang diciptakan minggu lepas pada
Vis det jeg laget i forrige uke på
Toon wat ik vorige week aangemaakt heb op
Mostrar todas as minhas notas no
Mostre o que eu criei na semana passada no
Покажи мне что я создал на прошлой неделе в
Visa mig alla mina anteckningar i
Visa mig vad jag skapade förra veckan i
แสดงโน้ตทั้งหมดบนแอพ
แสดงสิ่งที่ฉันสร้างอาทิตย์ที่แล้วในแอพ
represents the name of the app whose Intents extension handles the request.

abstract.text: Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
Constants indicating the type of date-based search to perform.
A request to fulfill in your app or Intents extension.
Constants indicating the type of location-based search to perform.
Constants indicating the types of items to search.
A request to search for notes, tasks, and reminders.
The text to search for in the body of a note.
An indicator of how to apply date values to your search.
The value to use when performing date-based searches.
Initializes the intent object with the specified search parameters.
Initializes the intent object with the specified search parameters.
The type of items to include in your search.
The value to use when searching for location-triggered reminders.
An indicator of how to apply location values to your search.
The unique identifier that your app assigned to the item.
The completion state to look for when searching for tasks.
The title text to search for in a note, task, or task list.
The handler interface for searching for notes, tasks, and reminders.
Your app’s response to a request to search for notes, tasks, or reminders.
Constants indicating the priority for a task.
Constants indicating the completion state of a task.
Constants indicating how often to trigger an event.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
